intro: Schizoglossum elatum, commonly known as the mountain beard plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, branched inflorescence. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense, brush-like structure that gives it its common name. Schizoglossum elatum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the harsh climate of its native habitat.
